publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

msIdentifier.repository: Bibliothèque nationale de France, fonds Pelliot Koutchéen (Paris)

altIdentifier.idno: Pelliot Koutchéen Compatibilité de monastère 38 [PK Cp 38]

seg.seg: In the 5th regnal year of the king Nāśmi, (a year of) [sheep/goat]. /// /// obtained.
On the 15th day, Koraña gave food. ... [the Buddha] ... (by giving its price) as [5] (coins). The other, Miki[n]e took (by giving its price) as 5 (coins).
On the 16th day, the women of Ṣomoksa* gave food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained : 2. They have been sold, each for four (coins). The total in coins: 8.
On the 23rd day, the citizen (and) the rural (women gave food. The portions that the Buddha) [obtained]: 2. They have been sold, each for five (coins). The total in coins : 10.
On the 24th day, the citizen Aṣtamikka*-women [gave] food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained : 2. They have been sold, each for five (coins). The total in coins : 10.
On the last day of the month, Wrau of Olyīṣkā [gave food]. /// /// [2]. They have been sold, each for four (coins. The total in coins:) 10.

On the 15th day of the 6th (month), the people of Laikār* gave food. [The portions (that) the Buddha obtained:] (2.) One has been sold for five (coins). The other, the novice Jñānaciwe took (by giving its price) as 5 (coins).
On the 28th day of the 4th (month), Saṅkatāse of Paśarki gave food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: 2. One has been sold for 5 (coins), the other he ate himself.
Der Buddha erhielt zwei (2) Teile; ein [Teil] wurde für fünf (5) verkauft.
The Buddha received two (2) portions; one [portion] was sold for five (5).
On the 17th day, Koroñciśka of Olyīśkā (gave) food. The portion (that) the Buddha obtained : one. It has been sold for 4 (coins).
On the 23rd day, Mpek Ccor [gave] food. [The portions (that) the Buddha obtained:] (2. One) [has been sold] for five (coins). The other, Ṅkitsai took (by giving its price) as 5 (coins).

On the 24th day, Tarmaiśye gave food. The portions (that) [the Buddha obtained]: 2. The one, Śiṅkācca took (by giving its price) as five (coins). [The other, Raktaswiñi] (took by giving its price as) [5] (coins).
On the last day of the month, Śiṅkācca [gave food]. /// /// (one). [Śiṅkācca took] (by giving its price) as 4 (coins).
On the 1st day, Ṣirecca gave food. [The portions] (that the Buddha) obtained: 2. They have been sold, each for four (coins). The total in coins: [8].
On the 7th day of the month, the portions (that) the Buddha (obtained: 3) [They have been sold, each for four coins. The total] in coins: 12.

On the 15th day, Koraña gave food. [The portions (that) the Buddha] obtained: 3. One has been sold for four (coins). Another, Śirmāñca [took] (by giving its price) as four coins. The rest one), [Raktaswiñi took] (by giving its price) as four (coins).
On the 22nd day, Śilasome [made] sarañi. [The portion] (that the Buddha) obtained: one. It has been sold for 3 (coins).

On the 23rd day, Ṣoṅkseṃ [gave food]. The portion (that) [the Buddhas obtained]: 3. One has been sold for 4 (coins). Another, Puttikka took (by giving its price) as 4 coins. (The rest one) [Airkāca] took (by giving its price) as 4 (coins).
On the 27th day of the 10th (month), Cutte gave food /// /// [4] (coins). The other, Caitike took (by giving its price) as 4 (coins). /// /// ...
On the 2nd day of the 5th (month), Erkañciśke [gave food. The portions (that) the Buddha] obtained : 2. The one, Kercapiśke took (by giving its price) as 5 (coins). [The other] ///
On the 8th day of the 11th (month), [Supriye gave] (food). The portion (that) the Buddha obtained: one. [I] gave the order to shave ... large/great patsaśiś.
On the 15th day, Siñātsi [gave] food. (The portions that the Buddha) [obtained: 2. They have been sold], each for five (coins). The total in coins: 10.
On the 8th day of the 12th [month, Wrau] of Olyīśkā [gave food]. The portion (that) the Buddha obtained: one. It has been sold for 2 (coins).
On the 19th day, Kyauṅku gave food. (The portions that the Buddha obtained):[2]. The one has been sold for 4 (coins). [The other] has been sold for 3 (coins).
Accordingly, the coins as the income [are] /// ///
On the 20th day of the 4th (month), I bought fragrance ... /// /// has seen.
On the 8th day of the month, Yśiñātsi [gave food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained : 2.] They have been sold, each for five (coins. The total:) 10.
For the full moon of the 5th (month), [I bought] fragrance /// /// [Kercapiśke has seen]. [SIGNUM]
On the 9th day of the 6th month, (I bought) keklyenta. /// /// [Jñānasene] has seen.
On the 11th day, Kercapiśke (left in order to) mill wheat. [For paying the fee], I gave him the [stūpas'] coins: 25. [Kercapiśke]'s finger-measure. [SIGNUM]
On the 21st day, Kercapiśke (left in order to mill) [wheat]. /// /// ... I gave him the coins to pay the fee (distributed to ?) the stūpa/Buddha: 2[7]. (Kercapiśke's) [finger-measure]. [SIGNUM]
The 7th month. (On) the 6th day of the month, ... [fragrance] ... for 2 (coins). [C]i- /// /// [finger-measure]
For prawarik*, [I bought] ... for the lamp to/of the Buddhas: two and a half pints, for 10 (coins). [Kercapiśke] (has seen. Finger-measure.) [SIGNUM]
On the [23rd] day of the 8th (month), [I bought] fragrance for [4/5] (coins). [Kercapiśke] (has seen). This (is his) finger-measure. [SIGNUM]
On the 21st day of the 9th (month), ... [Anandadewe] /// /// ... to give 50 (coins). [Jñānarakṣite] (has recognized).
On the 13th day of the 10th (month), [I bought] fragrance /// /// [has seen. This (is his) finger-measure].
On the 17th day of (the month), I bought kekleynta for three (coins). /// /// (has seen. This is his) finger-measure. [SIGNUM]
For the full moon of the 11th (month, I bought) fragrance /// /// [Pu] /// /// (has seen. This is his/her) finger-measure.
On the 13th day of the 12th (month), I gave to [Indrawarme] (coins): [3], in order to (pay) the fee of milling. [Indrawarme's Finger-measure.]

On the 9th day of the month, Śaṅke of Ṣomoksa* [gave] food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained : 2. One has been sold for 4 (coins). The other Jñānaciwe the novice took (by giving its price) as 4 (coins).
On the 11th day, [Suklyike's people] gave food. [The portions (that) the Buddha obtained : 2. They have been sold, each for three (coins)]. (The total:) 6 (coins).

p.note: Lines are a chronological record of incomes of the monastery, lines are a record of expenses; the ms. is a revised copy of and ; see .
Consisting of an alignment of six paper sheets of 37,3 cm (lines 1–14), 36,9 cm (lines 15–29), 34,2 cm (lines 30–43), 36,4 cm (lines 44–48), 36,7 cm (lines 49–60), and 37,3 cm height (lines 61–69).

I gave him the coins to pay the fee (distributed to ?) the stūpa/Buddha: 2[7]. (Kercapiśke's) [finger-measure]. [SIGNUM] 56-57 The 7th month. (On) the 6th day of the month, ... [fragrance] ... for 2 (coins). [C]i- /// /// [finger-measure] 58-59 For prawarik*, [I bought] ... for the lamp to/of the Buddhas: two and a half pints, for 10 (coins). [Kercapiśke] (has seen. This is his/her) finger-measure. 68-69 On the 13th day of the 12th (month), I gave to [Indrawarme] (coins): [3], in order to (pay) the fee of milling. [Indrawarme's Finger-measure.]
Consisting of an alignment of six paper sheets of 37,3 cm (lines 1–14), 36,9 cm (lines 15–29), 34,2 cm (lines 30–43), 36,4 cm (lines 44–48), 36,7 cm (lines 49–60), and 37,3 cm height (lines 61–69).
Pelliot Koutchéen Duldur Aqur M 507(38), Pelliot Koutchéen Compatibilité de monastère 38 [PK Cp 38]

Malzahn–
Tamai–

Translations from [[Schmidt KT 1974]]
Lines Translation Pages
2-3 Der Buddha erhielt zwei (2) Teile; ein [Teil] wurde für fünf (5) verkauft. 250

  • [[Ching 2010]] [159] cites "Couvreur 1954" but has only "Couvreur 1954a" (= our [[Couvreur 1954]]) and "Couvreur 1954b" (= our [[Couvreur 1954a]]) in her bibliography [631]. Maybe she means "Couvreur 1953" (= our [[Couvreur 1953a]]) anyway? –Martin (Tue, 2014-11-11, 01:10:50)
  • 30 ṣe 〈ke〉śne (Ching) or ṣe keśne (Pinault)? –Martin (Tue, 2014-11-11, 01:43:35)
  • 31 pañekte (Ching) or pañikte (Pinault)? –Martin (Tue, 2014-11-11, 01:43:35)
  • Concerning the translation of 5, 8, 11, ... māk see [[Ching 2010]]: 475. –Martin (Tue, 2014-11-11, 01:43:35)
  • 36 Where does the restoration in wasa pa) begin? (BK)
    • I changed it to wasa (pa), which is probably correct. –Martin (Thu, 2019-01-03, 17:54:03 (CET))

wsare pa[ñ]i(kte pakenta kalwa wi 2 _p_l_aṅkār)e (tr)[e]yā_r\ 6 10 _p_alletne koraña śwālla wasa pa[ñ](ikte) /// /// (pis)sa 5 ṣe 11 me mikine kamāte pissa 5 mā_k\ 12 śa_ṣ_k_asne ṣomoksañana klaiyna śwālle wsare pañikte pakenta kalwa wi 2 _p_l_aṅkā 13 re śwerā_r\ ṣe keśne cāneṃntsa o_k\ 8 14 i_k_aṃ traiyne riñāna k_uṣaineṣana (klaiyna śwālle wsare pañikte pakenta ka)l[w]a wi 2 _p_l_aṅkā 15 re piśā_r\ «†–» ṣe keśne cāneṃntsa śa_k\ 10 16 i_k_aṃ śwerne riñāna āṣtamikkana śwālle wsa[r](e pa)ñikte pakenta kalwa wi 2 _p_l_aṅkāre 17 p_iśā_r\ ṣe keśne cāneṃntsa śa_k\ 10 18 ñuweṃne olyīśkāṣṣe wrau śwāl(l)e (wasa) /// /// [w]i _p_l_aṅkāre pśā_r\ 10 19 ṣkace _p_alletne laikārñi śwālle wsar(e) [p](a)[ñ](ikte pa)[k](en)t(a) [k](al)w(a wi 2 ṣe p)l(a)ṅk(a) pissa 5 20 ṣeme jñānaciwe nawāke pis(s)a 5 mā 21 śak ṣukne olyīśkāṣa koroñciśka śwālle (wasa) pañikte pāke kalwa ṣeme plaṅka 22 śwersa 4 23 i_k_aṃ traiyne mpe_k\ cco_r\ śwālle wa(sa pa)[ñ](ikte pa)[k](en)[t](a) [k](alwa wi 2 ṣe p)l(a)ṅka pisa 5 24 ṣeme «ṅ»kitsai kamāte pisa 5 25 i_k_aṃ śwerne tarmaiyśe śwālle wasa pañ[i]k[t]e pakenta ka wi 2 ṣeme śiṅkā 26 cca kamāte pisa ṣe ra[k](tasw)i(ñ)i (kamāte pisa) [5] 27 ñuweṃne śiṅkācca śwālle wa(sa) /// /// (ṣeme ś)i(ṅk)ā(cca) [ka]māte 28 śwersa 4 29 pratiwatne ṣirecca śwālle wasa (pañikte pa)kenta kalwa wi 2 _p_l_aṅkāre śwe 30 rā_r\ ṣe keśne cāneṃntsa o_k\ [8] 31 ṣu_k\ meñantse ne pañikte pakenta [k](alwa tarya _p)[_l_aṅ]k(ā)r(e) św(e)[r](ā)_r\ ṣṣ(e) k(e)śne cā 32 neṃntsa śak wi 10-2 33 _p_alletne koraña śwālle wasa pa(ñ)i(kte pake)n(t)a kalwa tarya 3 ṣe plaṅka 34 śwersa 4 śirmāñca ka[mā](te śwersa 4 ṣeme raktasw)i[ñ]i (ka)[m]āte śwersa 4 35 i_k_aṃne śilasome sarañi ma(ṣṣa pañikte) [p]āke kalwa ṣeme plaṅka traiysa 3 36 i_k_aṃ traiyne kwaṣaiyne ṣoṅkseṃ św[ā](l)l(e) wasa (pa)ñi[k](t)e pakenta ka tarya 3 ṣe plaṅka 37 śwersa 4 ṣeme puttikka kamāte (św)e(rsa 4 ṣeme ai)r(k)ā(ca) kamāte śwersa 4 38 śkañce i_k_aṃ ṣukne cutte śwālle wasa /// /// (ś)wer(s)a 4 ṣe 39 me caitike kamāte śwersa 4 40 – wärsaññe o_k\ meñantse n(e s)[u](p)r(iye śwālle wa)sa pañikte pāke kalwa 41 ṣeme cowa_k\ pākesa oroce pa(tsaśi_ś\ ma)r(ka)si yātkawa ¤ 42 _p_alletne siñātsi śwālle wa[s](a pañikte pakenta ka)[l](wa) [w]i _p_l_aṅ[k]āre p_iśā_r\ ṣe 43 keśne cāneṃntsa śa_k\ 10 44 rapaññe o_k\ mentse ne olyīśkāṣṣe (wr)au (św)ā(ll)e (wasa) pañikte pāke«†nta» kalwa 45 ṣeme plaṅka wisa 2 46 śak ñune kyauṅku śwālle wasa (pañikte pakenta kalwa wi) [2] (ṣe) plaṅka śwe 47 rsa 4 ṣe plaṅka traiysa 3 48 caiyä\ cāñi te yiknesa wyai tak(ā)[r](e) 49 śtarce i_k_aṃne tuñä\ _k_aryāmai [śwe] /// /// lyāka 50 piṅkce _p_allenti_ś\ tuñ\ _k_a[ryā]m[ai] (– ke)rcapiśke ly(ā)ka 51 ṣkace ñu meñantse ne kekleynta (_k_aryāmai) [j](ñ)ānasene lyāka 52 śak ṣene kercapiśke y«†k»sāre wā_lsa(si masa) p(i)t(o) aiss(i) pt(a)m(a)ṣṣeṃ cāneṃ 53 wsāwane i_k_aṃ pi_ś\ 20-5 – – (–) ntse kapci 54 i_k_aṃ ṣene kercapiśke ysā(re – – wā_lsa)[s]i p[t]amaṣṣeṃ pito aisi 55 cāneṃ wsāwa i_k_aṃ ṣu_k\ 20-[7] /// /// k(ap)[c](i) 56 meñe ṣuktante ṣka_s\ meñantse [tu] /// /// (w)[i]sa 2 57 [c]i /// /// k(a)pc(i) 58 prawariki_ś\ pañik«†i»«t[e]»_s\ c(o)[k](i_ś\ – _k_a)ryāmai wi ṣaṅ_k_aṃ ywārtsa śaktsa 59 10 kerca(p)i(śkentse kapc)i 60 oktañce i_k_aṃ traiyne tuñä\ _k_a[ry](āmai śwersa) [4] 61 ke[rc](apiśke lyāka) se kapci 62 ñuñce i_k_aṃ ṣene ananda[d]e(w)e /// /// ·i – – – aisi «†50» 63 p_iśāka 50 jñānara(kṣite lyāka) 64 śkañce śak traiyne tuñä\ _k_aryā(m)[ai] /// /// [l](yā)[ka] (s)e [ka]pci 65 śak ṣukne kekleynta _k_aryāmai trai[y]sa /// /// s(e) kapci 66 wärsaññe _p_allenti_ś\ tuñä\ [_k_a](ryāmai) /// /// 67 [pu] /// /// (ka)pc[i] 68 rapañe śak traiyne indrawa(rm)[e](ntse cāneṃ wsāwa) traiy\ 3 waltsasintse 69 pito_ś\ i(nd)[r](awarmentse kapc)[i]

Lines 1-47 are a chronological record of incomes of the monastery, lines 49-69 are a record of expenses; the ms. is a revised copy of [[PK DA M 507.35]] and [[PK DA M 507.42 and .40]]; see [[Pinault 2014a]].
Bibliothèque nationale de France, fonds Pelliot Koutchéen (Paris)

div.p:
Alternative classifications:

  • </bibl> [159] cites "Couvreur 1954" but has only "Couvreur 1954a" (= our <bibl><title corresp="ref:couvreur1954"/></bibl>) and "Couvreur 1954b" (= our <bibl><title corresp="ref:couvreur1954a"/></bibl>) in her bibliography [631]. Maybe she means "Couvreur 195<ref type="ms" target="__3"/>" (= our <bibl><title corresp="ref:couvreur1953a"/></bibl>) anyway? –Martin (Tue, 2014-11-11, 01:10:50)</li><li><ref type="ms" target="__30"/><hi>ṣe 〈ke〉śne</hi> (Ching) or <hi>ṣe keśne</hi> (Pinault)? –Martin (Tue, 2014-11-11, 01:43:35)</li><li><ref type="ms" target="__31"/><hi>pañekte</hi> (Ching) or <hi>pañikte</hi> (Pinault)? –Martin (Tue, 2014-11-11, 01:43:35)</li><li>Concerning the translation of <ref type="ms" target="__5, 8, 11, ..."/> <hi>māk</hi> see <bibl><title corresp="ref:ching2010"/><citedRange>475</citedRange></bibl>. –Martin (Tue, 2014-11-11, 01:43:35)</li><li><ref type="ms" target="__36"/> Where does the restoration in <hi>wasa pa)</hi> begin? (BK) <ul><li>I changed it to <hi>wasa (pa)</hi>, which is probably correct. –Martin (Thu, 2019-01-03, 17:54:03 (CET))</li></ul></li></ul></project_comment>
